A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Ignore the negativity from the 'die-hards'. The movie was awesome. It was fresh\, unique\, and had surprises left and right. It was the first time I've felt a Star Wars movie since Empire was unpredictable and had taken risks. The 'die-hards' need to let the past be the past. Not every movie can be a re-hash carbon copy of the originals. The biggest complaint against Force Awakens was that it was too much like New Hope. Now\, a Star Wars movie that has brief touches with the past\, yet separates itself from the old ways in a refreshing way does not satisfy them. Newsflash\, you're not going to impress a new generation of fans with the same plot over and over again. Let the originals and the Skywalker narrative be remembered for how great they were\, and appreciate a new generation of characters and action. This was awesome.
